title: Ezekiel Chapter 48 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 48 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 48 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 48.

questions.question: Which tribe's portion is described as from the north end to the coast of the way of Hethlon?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:1 specifies the portion for Dan from the north end to the coast of the way of Hethlon.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48:11, which priests are sanctified and have kept God's charge?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:11 mentions the priests sanctified of the sons of Zadok who kept God's charge.

questions.question: What is the breadth of the holy oblation land offered unto the LORD?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:9 states the oblation shall be five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth.

questions.question: Which tribe is allocated a portion by the border of Benjamin?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:24 states that by the border of Benjamin, Simeon shall have a portion.

questions.question: True or False: The sanctuary of the LORD shall be in the midst of the oblation offered.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:10 confirms that the sanctuary of the LORD shall be in the midst of the holy oblation.

questions.question: What is the length measurement of the city as described in Ezekiel 48:30?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:30 states the goings out of the city on the north side are four thousand and five hundred measures.

questions.question: Which tribe's gate is NOT listed on the north side of the city?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31 lists gates on the north side as Reuben, Judah, and Levi, excluding Benjamin.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The name of the city from that day shall be, 'The _____ is there.'
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:35 states the city's name shall be, 'The LORD is there.'

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48:14, what is forbidden concerning the firstfruits of the land?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:14 says the firstfruits of the land shall not be sold, exchanged, nor alienated as it is holy unto the LORD.

questions.question: The city gates on the east side include the gate of which of these tribes?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:32 states the east side gates include Joseph, Benjamin, and Dan.

questions.question: True or False: The portions for the prince are located over against the holy oblation on both east and west borders.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:21 explains the residue for the prince is on both sides of the holy oblation at the east and west borders.

questions.question: Which tribe's portion borders the coast of the way of Hethlon and the border of Damascus?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:1 describes the portion for Dan as reaching from the north end to the coast of the way of Hethlon and the border of Damascus.

questions.question: What is the width and length of the oblation offered to the LORD as given in Ezekiel 48:20?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:20 states all the oblation shall be five and twenty thousand by five and twenty thousand.

questions.question: Which tribe's gate is located on the south side of the city?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:33 lists the south side gates as Simeon, Issachar, and Zebulun.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites shall have a portion measuring 25,000 in length and 10,000 in breadth.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:13 states the Levites shall have a portion of twenty-five thousand in length and ten thousand in breadth.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 48 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 48 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with contentment in their possessions. Based on Ezekiel 48, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God's provision?
options: God has already apportioned what belongs to each tribe and individual.
We must strive to acquire more than others to be content.
Possessions are temporary and should be ignored.
Contentment comes from worldly success alone.
questions.correctAnswer: God has already apportioned what belongs to each tribe and individual.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:29 explains the land is divided by lot to the tribes of Israel, showing God's sovereign provision and order. Verses 1-7 and 23-27 also detail the specific portions, teaching trust in God's just allocation.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 teach the importance of holiness and stewardship in the context of land and resources?
options: The land and its firstfruits are holy and must not be sold or exchanged.
Land should be sold quickly for profit to increase wealth.
Stewardship is only necessary for priests and Levites.
The land is common property with no restrictions.
questions.correctAnswer: The land and its firstfruits are holy and must not be sold or exchanged.
questions.explanation: Verse 14 emphasizes that the land's firstfruits are holy to the LORD and must not be sold or alienated. Verses 9-13 further describe the holy oblation for priests and Levites, stressing stewardship and reverence.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with perseverance through trials and wandering from God. How does Ezekiel 48 encourage faithfulness?
options: The sons of Zadok are honored for not straying when others did.
Faithfulness is not important if others are disobedient.
God only rewards the majority, not the faithful few.
Straying is expected and forgiven without repentance.
questions.correctAnswer: The sons of Zadok are honored for not straying when others did.
questions.explanation: Verse 11 honors the sons of Zadok for keeping God's charge and not going astray when others did, teaching the blessing of faithfulness in trials. This relates also to verses 12-13 about their holy portion.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 demonstrate the importance of order and integrity in the distribution of responsibilities within the community?
options: Each tribe and group receives a specific portion and role according to God's plan.
Responsibilities are given randomly without structure.
Only one tribe receives all responsibilities.
Order is unimportant as long as the community prays.
questions.correctAnswer: Each tribe and group receives a specific portion and role according to God's plan.
questions.explanation: Verses 1-7 and 23-27 list the territorial portions for each tribe, while verses 9-13 assign holy portions for priests and Levites, showing God's intentional order and integrity in community roles.

questions.question: A church leader wants to teach about generosity and stewardship. What biblical principle from Ezekiel 48 would you highlight?
options: The holy oblation and land portions are sacred and dedicated to the LORD's service.
Generosity is optional and unrelated to land.
Stewardship means accumulating wealth for oneself.
Only the prince is responsible for generosity.
questions.correctAnswer: The holy oblation and land portions are sacred and dedicated to the LORD's service.
questions.explanation: Verses 8-13 describe the sacred land given to priests and Levites as holy oblation, teaching that stewardship involves dedicating resources to God's service. Verse 20 also affirms the holy oblation is foursquare with the city.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 48 teach about humility and contentment in relation to the city and its measurements?
options: The city is precisely measured and centered so all may live in peace and order.
The city size is insignificant and random.
Contentment comes from owning more land than others.
Humility means rejecting any city or community life.
questions.correctAnswer: The city is precisely measured and centered so all may live in peace and order.
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 and 30 describe exact city measurements and suburbs, emphasizing a God-ordained orderly living space that encourages humility and contentment rather than greed or envy.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 encourage believers to serve others within the church community?
options: Those who serve the city come from all tribes, showing inclusive service.
Only one tribe serves the city.
Service is optional for most tribes.
Service should be limited to family members.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who serve the city come from all tribes, showing inclusive service.
questions.explanation: Verse 19 states that those who serve the city shall serve it from all tribes of Israel, teaching inclusiveness and collective responsibility in church life and service.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 48, the gates of the city are named after the tribes of Israel to remind believers of their identity and unity.
questions.explanation: Verses 31-34 specify the gates named after the tribes of Israel, symbolizing their identity and unity in the city, encouraging believers to remember their heritage and unity in God.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 48 teaches that the holy oblation and prince’s portion are separate and not connected with the sanctuary or city.
questions.explanation: Verses 21-22 explain the residue for the prince is among the holy oblation and city possession, with the sanctuary of the house in the midst, showing their connection and unity.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 48:15, the five thousand breadth over against the five and twenty thousand is described as a _____ place for the city, for dwelling, and for suburbs.
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states this area shall be a profane place, meaning common ground for the city’s dwelling and suburbs, distinguishing it from the holy oblation.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 inspire believers to maintain honesty and integrity in their work and dealings?
options: God's clear allotment of land teaches fairness and integrity in distribution.
Deceit in dividing land is expected and tolerated.
Honesty is only important for priests and Levites.
Work integrity depends on personal gain.
questions.correctAnswer: God's clear allotment of land teaches fairness and integrity in distribution.
questions.explanation: The entire chapter outlines precise boundaries and portions (verses 1-7, 23-27, 29), reflecting God's demand for honest and fair dealings, applicable to all work ethics.

questions.question: A believer is finding it hard to forgive others and reconcile. What does the orderly and peaceful division in Ezekiel 48 teach about reconciliation?
options: God’s design for the tribes to live side by side teaches the importance of peace and reconciliation.
Conflict and division among tribes are God’s will.
Reconciliation is only for priests and Levites.
Reconciliation is unnecessary if boundaries are respected.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s design for the tribes to live side by side teaches the importance of peace and reconciliation.
questions.explanation: Verses 1-7 and 23-28 detail tribes’ borders designed to coexist, teaching believers to pursue peace and reconciliation in community life.

questions.question: How does the presence of the sanctuary in the midst of the holy oblation area (Ezekiel 48) teach believers about the centrality of God in family and church life?
options: God’s sanctuary is at the center, reminding us to keep Him central in all areas of life.
The sanctuary is unimportant and can be on the outskirts.
Family and church life should focus on material success.
God’s presence is only for priests and leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s sanctuary is at the center, reminding us to keep Him central in all areas of life.
questions.explanation: Verses 8-10 and 21 emphasize the sanctuary in the midst of the holy oblation, symbolizing God's central place in community, family, and worship.

questions.question: What practical lesson about prayer and spiritual discipline can be drawn from the detailed measurements and divisions in Ezekiel 48?
options: Spiritual discipline requires order, precision, and consistent dedication like the city’s layout.
Prayer can be random and without structure.
Discipline in prayer is unnecessary for spiritual growth.
Measurements in the city have no spiritual parallel.
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual discipline requires order, precision, and consistent dedication like the city’s layout.
questions.explanation: The exact measurements in verses 16-17, 30-35 reflect the importance of order and consistency, which can be applied to personal spiritual disciplines such as prayer and devotion.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 encourage believers to witness and evangelize through their stewardship?
options: By faithfully stewarding God’s gifts, believers reflect His holiness and attract others to Him.
Stewardship is only for personal benefit.
Witnessing depends solely on preaching, not lifestyle.
questions.correctAnswer: By faithfully stewarding God’s gifts, believers reflect His holiness and attract others to Him.
questions.explanation: Verses 9-14 and 20 describe holy portions and dedicated land showing God’s holiness, teaching that faithful stewardship is a powerful witness to others.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 48 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 48.

questions.question: Which tribe is allotted the northernmost portion according to Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:1 details the northernmost portion being given to the tribe of Dan, marking the starting point of the tribal allotments from north to south.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48, which tribe's portion lies immediately to the east and west of the portion of Ephraim?
questions.explanation: Verses 48:4 to 48:6 show that Manasseh borders Ephraim on one side and Reuben on the other, illustrating the contiguous tribal allotments.

questions.question: What is the significance of the sanctuary being 'in the midst' of the offering in Ezekiel 48?
options: It symbolizes God's presence among His people
It indicates the central market place
It refers to the prince's palace location
It marks the boundary for the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's presence among His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:8 and 48:10 emphasize that the sanctuary is centrally located within the holy oblation, indicating the theological theme of God's dwelling in the midst of Israel.

questions.question: Which priestly family is specifically mentioned as being sanctified and faithful in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:11 highlights the sons of Zadok as priests who remained faithful when others strayed, distinguishing them for the holy oblation.

questions.question: True or False: The land offered to the Levites and priests in Ezekiel 48 could be sold or exchanged.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:14 clearly states that the holy portions of the land shall not be sold, exchanged, or alienated because they are holy to the LORD.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48, what measurement is given for the breadth of the oblation for the priests?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:9-10 describe the oblation for the priests as being ten thousand reeds in breadth and twenty-five thousand in length.

questions.question: Which two tribes have their portions located adjacent to the borders of Judah and Benjamin, where the prince’s possession is placed?
options: Levites and the possession of the city
questions.correctAnswer: Levites and the possession of the city
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:22 explains that between the borders of Judah and Benjamin, the possession of the Levites and the city are within the prince’s possession, indicating their close proximity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The gates of the city in Ezekiel 48 are named after the tribes of Israel and there are ___ gates on each side of the city.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31-34 states that each side of the city has three gates named after specific tribes, emphasizing the city's organization and inclusivity.

questions.question: What is the total circumference of the city described in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:35 states the city is surrounded by eighteen thousand measures, indicating the vast size of the city in the prophetic vision.

questions.question: Which tribe receives the southernmost portion of the land according to Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:27-28 indicate that the border of Gad lies at the southern side, stretching from Tamar to the waters of strife in Kadesh, marking it as the southernmost allotment.

questions.question: Which tribe's portion is allocated immediately after the border of Benjamin, according to Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:24 specifies that Simeon’s portion is next to Benjamin’s, showing the sequence of tribal allotments in the vision.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'residue' land mentioned in Ezekiel 48:18?
options: For food to those who serve the city
questions.correctAnswer: For food to those who serve the city
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:18 clarifies that the residue of the land is intended as sustenance for those serving the city, indicating a social-economic function connected to the city’s service.

questions.question: True or False: The tribal gates of the city include gates named after Levi and Joseph.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31-32 list gates named after Levi on the north side and Joseph on the east side, confirming their inclusion among the city gates.

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in Ezekiel 48 by listing tribal allotments in a specific geographical order?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:1-29 uses sequential border delineation, systematically assigning tribal portions from north to south and east to west, reflecting an orderly prophetic vision of land restoration.

questions.question: Which theme prevalent in Ezekiel 48 echoes the promise of God’s presence among His people as seen in other biblical texts such as Exodus and Revelation?
options: The sanctuary in the midst of the city
questions.correctAnswer: The sanctuary in the midst of the city
questions.explanation: The repeated emphasis on the sanctuary being in the midst (Ezekiel 48:8, 10, 21) parallels Exodus 25:8 and Revelation 21:3, where God promises to dwell among His people, highlighting continuity in biblical theology.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 48 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 48 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48, what is the significance of the sanctuary being in the midst of the land portion offered to the tribes?
options: It symbolizes God's presence among His people
It marks the border between the tribes
It serves as a military fortress
It is a marketplace for all tribes
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's presence among His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:8, 10, and 21 emphasize the sanctuary being in the midst of the land portions, indicating God's abiding presence among Israel. This reflects God's promise in Leviticus 26:11-12, and parallels with New Testament teaching that God dwells in believers (John 14:23; 1 Corinthians 3:16).

questions.question: Which tribe is allotted the first portion from the north end according to Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:1 specifies that from the north end, the portion for Dan is given first. This ordering of tribal allotments reflects God's sovereign distribution similar to the order in Numbers 2:25-31 and Joshua 19:40-48.

questions.question: What is the size of the holy oblation land reserved for the priests, as described in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:9-10 details the dimensions of the priests’ holy oblation as 25,000 in length and 10,000 in breadth, emphasizing the sanctity and specific allocation for priestly service, consistent with Numbers 18:20-24 and 2 Chronicles 31:4-5.

questions.question: Who among the priests are specifically mentioned as receiving the holy oblation in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:11 identifies the sons of Zadok as the priests who receive the holy oblation because they remained faithful when others strayed, reflecting God's approval of sanctified priesthood (cf. Ezekiel 44:15-16; Hebrews 7:11-14).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the land portions assigned to the Levites in Ezekiel 48?
options: To serve as a holy possession adjacent to the priests' land
To be used as farmland for all tribes
To be sold and exchanged freely
To be given as a royal estate
questions.correctAnswer: To serve as a holy possession adjacent to the priests' land
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:12-13 shows the Levites having a holy portion next to the priests' land, not to be sold or exchanged, highlighting their special role and separation for service to God, consistent with Numbers 18:20-24 and Deuteronomy 10:9.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a restriction placed on the land portions in Ezekiel 48?
options: They must not be sold or exchanged
They must remain holy to the LORD
They must be used for idolatrous practices
questions.correctAnswer: They must be used for idolatrous practices
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:14 forbids selling, exchanging, or alienating the land because it is holy to the LORD, explicitly rejecting any idolatrous use, which is consistent with the holiness code in Leviticus 19:1-2 and 1 Corinthians 6:19-20.

questions.question: How many gates does the city have on each side, and how are they named in Ezekiel 48?
options: Three gates on each side, named after tribes of Israel
Four gates on each side, named after patriarchs
One gate on each side, named after the four gospels
Two gates on each side, named after angels
questions.correctAnswer: Three gates on each side, named after tribes of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31-34 describes three gates on each side of the city, each named for specific Israelite tribes, showing the unity and identity of the nation around God's presence, consistent with Revelation 21:12-13's depiction of the New Jerusalem gates named for the twelve tribes.

questions.question: What is the total measured circumference of the city described in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:35 states the city is eighteen thousand measures around, reflecting a perfect, complete measurement symbolic of divine order, similar to the New Jerusalem's dimensions in Revelation 21:16.

questions.question: What does the name of the city from that day forward signify in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:35 declares the city’s name as 'The LORD is there,' signifying God's presence with His people, fulfilling the promise of Immanuel (Isaiah 7:14; Matthew 1:23) and echoing God's presence in the tabernacle (Exodus 25:8).

questions.question: Which tribes have their gates on the north side of the city in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31 specifies that the north side gates are named for Reuben, Judah, and Levi, highlighting the organization of the tribes around the city, paralleling the tribal encampments in Numbers 2:3-9.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the increase of the residue land over against the oblation of the holy portion, as described in Ezekiel 48?
options: To provide food for those who serve the city
To be used for military training
To be sold for temple maintenance
To serve as a burial ground
questions.correctAnswer: To provide food for those who serve the city
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:18 explains that the increase of the residue land is for food to those who serve the city, illustrating God's provision for His ministers, consistent with Numbers 18:21-24 and Luke 10:7.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 48 depict the prince’s possession in relation to the holy oblation and the city?
options: On both sides of the holy oblation and the city
Only to the north of the city
Far away from the holy oblation
questions.correctAnswer: On both sides of the holy oblation and the city
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:21-22 shows the prince’s possession flanking the holy oblation and the city, indicating a privileged but separate role, consistent with royal stewardship seen in 2 Samuel 7:16 and Psalm 110.

questions.question: Which tribe receives the portion opposite to the border of Judah in Ezekiel 48?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:23 states that Benjamin receives a portion from the east to the west side opposite Judah, showing the balanced tribal allotment, consistent with Joshua 18:11-28 and Genesis 35:16-18.

questions.question: What is the significance of the city gates being named after the tribes of Israel in Ezekiel 48?
options: It symbolizes the unity and presence of all tribes around God's sanctuary
It marks the political boundaries of the city
It indicates which tribe controls each gate militarily
It is a memorial of conquered enemies
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes the unity and presence of all tribes around God's sanctuary
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:31-34 shows gates named for tribes, symbolizing the inclusion of all Israel in God's presence and worship, reflecting the unity of God's people as in Revelation 21:12-14 and Psalm 122:3.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 48, what is the width and length of the offering land around the sanctuary?
options: 25,000 reeds in breadth and as long as the other parts
10,000 reeds in breadth and 15,000 in length
questions.correctAnswer: 25,000 reeds in breadth and as long as the other parts
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 48:8 states the offering land is 25,000 reeds in breadth and as long as the other parts from east to west, indicating a substantial and holy space for worship, paralleling the concept of sacred space in Exodus 26:33 and Hebrews 9:2.
